position.marginalia_text: Mylord Buckhurst hath lykewyse addid his Epistle off co[m]mendatio[m], to M. Clarks Latin translation off [the] Courtier
Petrus Bizarus in suis Pöematis, facit Jöannem Ashleum Anglum, perfectum Castilionis Aulicum

marginalia.translation: Petrus Bizarus, in his Poematis, fashions the Englishman John Ashley as the perfect courtier of Castiglione.

position.marginalia_text: M. Ascham wrote his Discourse of Germane Affayres to this M. Astely; whereby it appearith that they had red togither Aristotles Rhetorique, Tully, and Livy. M. Blundeuil, in his praeface to Mylord off Leycester, before his Art off Ryding. I sawe my deare frend, M. John Ashly, M. off the Queenes Maiestyes Jewel horse, by they daily practising off the Rules off Grisons booke, withowt [the] help off any other Teacher, bring two off his Horses unto such A Perfection, as I belieue few Gentlemen in this Realme haue the lyke. Where he also comendith him not only for this exercise, but for many other Courtly and vertuous qualityes, as well off mynd, as off Boddy; thereby deseruing the looue, fauour, and commendatjon off all men. [Et cetera].
